"At seven o'clock, I believe." 
"At seven o'clock? It's very sad, very sad!" 
The Emperor thanked Prince Andrew and bowed. Prince Andrew withdrew and was im- mediately surrounded by courtiers on all sides. Everywhere he saw friendly looks and heard friendly words. Yesterday's adjutant re- proached him for not having stayed at the pal- ace, and offered him his own house. The Min- ister of War came up and congratulated him on the Maria Theresa Orderof the
